We had a party of five and were seated immediately. The steaks are expensive , but delicious. I like the side dishes that were large enough to to share. Had several serving staff that attended to us.

We went for our Anniversary Dinner. It was an excellent experience. Great food and everyone kept telling us Happy Anniversary. The owner even brought us some Champagne!

You'll pay for it, but Hall's is one of the best, if not the best, restaurants in Charleston. Although the menu is broad, I'd stick with the beef because that's what they're known for.

This deli is amazing! Great selection, very creative. The potato salad was to die for! We will return again on this trip!

This is my second time visiting the Deli and it was worth the 15 min wait. Their food is always great and they use Boars Head meat. Unique twist on classic sandwiches as well as their own originals. Prices are great and you walk away full, no small portions here. Will come back here again.

Loved it. Everything was so good and the place was beautiful too. Would definitely come again to try other things on the board that looked good. Black bean burger rocks and so does the broccoli salad.

While looking for a decent little sandwich spot, I stumbled upon this little gem...sandwiches were to die for! I was full half way in, but couldn't stop! Right in historic downtown Charleston, building was awesome. Great staff. Will be a lunch must stop every time in Charleston!

Great find a short walk from the Provost Dungeon! Our family all ordered different hot dogs. Not your average dogs! Service was awesome.
title: Brown Dog Deli, Charleston

review_list:
I liked the boisterous ambience and friendly waitstaff. But most of all, i liked the oysters, appetizers, and cocktails. Highly recommend.

Everything here is tasty, in a lively atmosphere, with a good happy hour menu. The peel & eat shrimp are a favorite treat.

We love happy hour here, as they offer amazing, fresh raw oysters and other outstanding selections. Beware, though, the cosmopolitans are strong!

If eating some raw oysters is on your agenda while visiting Charleston, Pearlz Oyster Bar is a great place to visit. The atmosphere and service is great as well.

FOOD was very reasonable.Drinks were a very good pour... Great atmosphere if you want to be around a lot of people... if you want quiet , romantic... this is not it.... if you want prices that are not out of line, and lots of people to talk to . this is it.

We fancied a light bite and a drink, found Pearlz Oyster Bar and chose some food from the Happy Hour Menu. Nice food, well prepared and very tasty, just what we wanted. A laid back atmosphere with good service, great spot to kill a couple of hours over a wine, Beer and some food.

Happy hour starts at 4pm and when I arrived at 430pm the bar was already packed. Great happy menu with oysters being the best seller. Had the jumbo shrimps, gumbo and corn fritters. Everything was delicious and the service was great. Would definitely return.

Go here..great food,drinks,atmosphere! You won't be disappointed! This is a welcoming and charming restaurant with fresh seafood. We loved it!

I just found this spot bike-riding along Bay street. It is small, with most seating on the stainless steel bar stools. It looks to be popular with younger couples.
The service is friendly, the food selection is good, and the preparation is very nice.

We were here for happy hour and were not disappointed. They had a deal on oysters that could not be beat. The place was pretty busy so get there early or make a reservation or you will have to wait. They also have a good selection of drinks. Our wait staff was helpful.

Real southern dishes, nicely prepared. Great table service. They were especially careful about an allergy at out table. I'd definitely return.

if you are looking for expertly prepare fried seafood, than this is the place. and the prices are reasonable.

Best little restaurant ever. Great service and fantastic food. Be prepared to wait for a table but the food is so worth it.

Snacks. The food was good as well as the drinks. The staff was really nice and the service was great.

My husband told waitress it was the best steak he's ever had and soon we got a free dessert!! Manager Ben was friendly! Told him I hadn't sampled the She crab soup yet and he went and brought me some to try. Delicious! Nice bar where we enjoyed the Packer game! Good appetizers!

Attentive staff, great ambience and excellent value for money food. We came for dinner rather later and were very pleased with the overall experience. Definitely recommended to any visitor coming to Charleston!

This was a great lunch choice. Weather was great and we sat by the open window area so we had a view of the market. Prices were reasonable. The cobb salad I had was excellent! Chicken fingers and sandwich were great too!

eclectic, interesting items for sale: jewelry, baskets, scarves, t-shirts, art, hats, more jewelry, low country photos.

Warm soup, flavorless salad, cold entrees without much flavor. Considering the cost, it's an overall poor execution. Please don't confuse it with Sermets on Daniel Island, which is much better.

Great place that is on King Street. We stopped in for apps & cocktails before a dinner reservation. Will definitely go back again and have dinner.

We stopped in for lunch because we wanted a nice sit down experience. The menu had a nice variety of offerings. We loved the reuben and chicken wrap. Our server was very attentative without being a nuisance. We'll come back!

We sat at the bar with Darcy. She was a great addition to our meal. The food was great: try the calamari and scallops. The wine list was amazing.

2 Years ago I have been visiting Thailand, and this restaurant is really authentic. It is a small place, so a reservation might be mandatory on busy days. Compared to American Fast Food it is pricy, but when you are sick of burgers and fries, it's worth it :)

Service was fast and kind.

Went on a wed afternoon. Wasn't too busy. Food was good. All 3 rolls we had were good.Prices comparable to other places we have eaten.

A very health option after all the rich fine southern cuisine Charleston has to offer. Fresh smoothies and juices, too. When you're green inside, you're clean inside!

The hotel is located in the heart of the city with easy walking distance to points of interest and all the fine dining that Charleston has to offer. Be sure to include the...


More  



Now called the Drawing Room, this restaurant is jumping on the bandwagon of Charleston fine dining restaurants in using local ingredients for inspired dishes.
I had the oysters on the half shell; they were perfectly fresh and tasty. My entrée, Triggerfish (a firm-fleshed white fish, not entirely dissimilar to Flounder) was very nice; with the accompanying dashi broth it was...


More  



The Vendue is a classic place of Southern charm and elegance. Every inch of it makes you want to go back again and again. The food is not to be missed

Came out for appetizers after getting a drink at the bar. Lots of tables to dine or lil' nook areas throughout the rooftop to sit and chat or drink wine on the couches and chairs. The bar is covered, but open to the outdoor rooftop as well. Enjoyed the food drinks and service. The weather and view were certainly a...


More  



amazing food and service--highly recommend it really sophisticated presentations, great wine list and excellent dessets

We were given a $25.00 gift certificate and glad we took advantage of it.
Food was outstanding as well as the service. Since we were their celebrating our 38th Wedding Anniversary, they provide dessert on the House.
High recommend it.

The restaurant is now called "The Drawing Room".
The food was excellent as was the service. Even though called the more casual of the dining options at the hotel the food was outstanding and the presentation was great.

The Vendue Inn has totally enhanced their restaurant. Everything is new, including the Chef!!! It is no longer called the Library. It is the Drawing Room at the Vendue Inn. What a fabulous meal we had last night. The foie gras was to do die for. Chef Jon Cropf's spin on sustainable fish, and vegetables is just crazy good! His...


More  



Optimistic food and drink menu. The artisanal cheese platter was excellent. Loved the drink menu, wished the bartender had not skipped steps/ingredients in the cocktails. Wait staff not as friendly as we have come to expect in Charleston. The atmosphere was full of fun quirks. The downstairs hosted a cliched art show, (really?

Highly recommend! The food was out of this world and was it was so artistically plated that it was almost a shame to eat. The ambience of the renovated space is very pleasing whether it be for a date night or dinner after having a drink on the roof top bar area.
title: Library at the Vendue Inn, Charleston

review_list:
We loved this little lounge. It's fun for taking a break and hanging out. My husband left his phone there and when we showed up to get it Dustin had it charging for us! Just a grt guy! Fun to talk with and my husband really enjoyed his cigar suggestions! My wine was good as well :)
If you want...


More  



Sat in some comfy chairs and had a glass of wine while chatting with Brother Don and an assortment of nice people on a chilly afternoon. Such a wonderful way to meet visitors and natives of Charleston. I just wish everywhere I went I could find such a place!

We stopped in to get my husband some cigars, the owner was very friendly and engaging. He asked my son if he was in the military and when he said yes, he insisted that my son take the military discount. As far as the tobacco is concerned, I am not a smoker but cigars, loose tobacco and wine was available...


More  



Stopped here for a few quiet drinks while relaxing on a Wednesday night. The venue was very relaxing and inviting and the service was great.. Dustin was very helpful and was extra friendly realising we were tourists.. The beer and wine was reasonably priced and the whole experience was a great memory on our trip. Definitely recommend!

Don is a true gentleman! He knows everything about the area, so don't be afraid to ask for recommendations! Dog friendly!

I visit Charleston 2 times a year, and always stop here a couple times. Great to sit out and have a nice wine with a cigar and talk tto the many locals and visitors that frequent here. Love iit.

The gentleman that owns this place is just lovely! Such a cool place with cigars and lovely bottles of wine - I highly recommend!

Walking downtown Charleston on a beautiful Friday morning we were sightseeing and shopping when my fiance smelled cigars. He is a big fan of a good smoke occasionally. We looked up and where in front of the Charlestowne Tobacco and Wine Shop. We opened the door and we're warmly greeted by Brother Don, an absolute character, historian, and gem of...

Stopped here for a break from walking around Charleston after my companion insisted on enjoying a cigar. I had not realizing she ever smoked cigars but she seemed to have had some practice! I although I enjoy a cigar now and then, I am not big in to the stronger smokes. Not being familiar with their stock, which was extensive,...

Brother Don is awesome. Wonderful cigar lounge. Don't miss out. Fantastic service. Great cigar, wine, beer selection.
title: Charlestowne Tobacco and Wine, Charleston

review_list:
Were were here in new year's eve. Surprisingly it was not crowded, but we were early, before dinner. A large and interesting cocktail list and attentive service from knowledgeable mixologists. The location is near the hotels and restaurants and the decor trendy and cozy.

Excellent choice for a drink with friends. Large selection of Bourbons, Scotchs, Ryes, and other whiskies. Fast friendly service. Very Enjoyable!!!

We had a fantastic time at Proof. Roger, one of the bartenders, made great drinks both on and off the menu. The place had a great, laid back vibe. Not too young. Not too old. We loved it.

If you're in Charleston and want to start (or end) your evening with a cocktail, Proof is the best. The list of cocktails covers every base and if something doesn't suit your tastes, just let the bartender know what style and liquor you prefer and they'll craft something "off menu" for you. I can't remember the last time I went...


More  



Proof has a great cocktail list, including some serious throwbacks that you can't find out very often. I tried several and found them all to be crafted to perfection and the service was excellent. You have got to try this spot.

Great cocktail bar where the owner is the bar keep. Very knowledgeable and personalized service and top shelf beverages. Limited menu but still have some appetizing food choices.

It was a really nice comfortable place, smaller than the other area bars which is a welcome thing. Great jazz music, good drinks and about 10 tables keeps it cozy.

Drinks were great and it was an interesting experience to watch them make the drinks. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I felt the bar tenders could have been more personable ... They weren't extremely enthusiastic when I asked questions about certain drinks. It's probably tiring for them but at the price point for each drink,...


More  



Stopped in as a result of the Southern Living review. They were right. Coolest place for a drink in Charleston. Small and dimly lit. Craig is a master! Let him decide what you're drinking. Loved it.

The cocktail menu here is extensive but the bartenders are great and very helpful so don't be intimidated. There's also a nice selection of craft beers and to aid with the drinks they have a small but excellent selection of snacks: delicious boiled peanuts, meatballs and cheese. Yum!!!
title: Proof, Charleston

Our family enjoyed a combination of lil Joe chicken and Big Joe pork sandwiches. Awesome Q! Just the right amount of smoke and sauce. The oak can't be faked. Tender meat. Did not order sides. Will check them out next time.

Pulled pork & sauces still really great. Sides are more food service quality & the corncake courtesy of Saralee; I saw the package. The Patriarch passed a few years ago & it shows. Only had one meal here while on my trip, used to be at least twice over 3-5 days.

Stopped in after visiting downtown area. Counter staff friendly and curteous. Meals were very good. Bride had pulled pork and had ribs, dry.

While looking for somewhere to eat, we came across this place. The parking lot and drive thru were packed so we thought this must be a really great place to eat. While traveling my husband said we should eat here. He grew up in Charleston. Wow!!! I loved the mustard based bar-b-que. We really enjoyed our meal here. The sushi was excellent, the service friendly but discreet. Great ginger sauce they do - new one on me. Make the effort if you're in the neighbourhood. Sadly, we left the next day.

The lady who runs it and served us was so lovely - shame we only...

If you're looking for good sushi with no frills, look no further. Good sushi, good service, and fair prices. Definitely worth a trip. Two of us had four rolls- spicy tuna, tuna avocado, shrimp tempura and spicy red snapper. All of them were solid. Definitely with a trip.

Our tuna and yellowtail sashimi was FROZEN. Woodbridge wine and cold edamame. It also took 20 minutes to get. Were they defrosting it?? Totally bummed.

Good quality, fresh ingredients, clean interior, very friendly staff.
I would go again.
My favourite Sushi that night: super crunch roll.
My GF's favourite Sushi that night: house special roll.

Prior to eating here, we stopped in and asked if it was BYOB. We did not see a bar and the owner said yes it is BYOB but there is a corking fee. We stopped next door and purchased a $12 bottle of sake. After returning and taking our seat we saw a drink menu complete with many varieties of...

Excellent food. Very nice people. My favorite Sushi place to come when I am in Charleston. Usually come for lunch, but wanted to try them for dinner.
Highly recommended.....

We go to Shi Ki at least once a week.
This is not only very welcoming but also very delicious.
You have to try the crunchy rolls!!!

Absolutely amazing sushi!!! The taste, texture, presentation, customer service, ambiance...everything was perfect!! Spur of the moment decision turned a frustrating evening into a wonderful experience of superb dining!!! Sushi Chef is excellent with artistic flair! Serving sizes ample for cost. Thrilled and will return when next in town!

We had dinner here because it was just a few blocks from our hotel and we love sushi. We had four rolls and an appetizer of edamame and everything was wonderful. The rolls were very well made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The food was delicious and we would highly recommend it!

Wanted a nice fast fresh lunch today. At 1210 stood in line for over five min and had to leave. Person at register was still taking a sandwich order and asking a thousand questions. Its soup and sandwich people take order and move on.

Lots of these restaurants in the Charleston area. I tried to Chicken Soup with Rice and it was delicious. The soups are homemade and very good. Great for a quick lunch - did not try to sandwiches but they looked good.

It had been several years since we enjoyed Ladles in West Ashley, but after the recent flooding we were looking for something simple for dinner. The obvious choice for both the wife and me, was Ladles.

The best made from scratch daily soups, gourmet sandwiches, and salads. A choice of 12 soups. Vegetarian, vegan, gluten free, low sodium choices.

Wonderful soups! Taste before you make your choice. Good salad and sandwiches! Staff was very friendly and helpful.

We stopped here for lunch after our visit to Drayton Hall. We each had a soup and sandwich - very hearty and filling.

Got off the boat from Sumter Island and was cold and hungry. Saw the small shop and could not resist the odor of simmering soup. The many flavors of soups and handmade sandwiches made it hard to decide but I had tomato bisque and a croque monsieur sandwich which was very good.

review_list:
Stopped here as we were interested in what the view was like. Pleasantly surprised at the quality of the buffet luncheon. Excellent variety and all food was well prepared and at the correct temperature, which I find difficult to achieve in a buffet style. Staff was very friendly and overall a very pleasant experience.

The view from the restaurant is gorgeous. We loved hanging at the bar with the bartender ( I think his name is Aaron). He was great!! We ate crab cakes at the bar and breakfast in the restaurant and the food was very good.

The view at nice is beautiful. Service is always well. A late dinner. Love the wings. Staff is always so friendly. Food always been great.

You'll come to this restaurant for the view but you will stay for the service. You will not find nicer or more helpful people in any restaurant in Charleston, and I really mean that. They will take a sincere interest in making sure you have a great experience.

My husband and I ate here while staying in the hotel. The food was excellent and our server, Jo, was a joy to have! Great place to eat if you are staying in the hotel and don't want to go out. A little pricey but no more so than other restaurants in other hotels.

great view!!!!-food just ok-service staff very good & attentive-went out of their way to help us, my husband is on oxygen and I had a broken ankle and the staff went out of their wy to help us-----good to see

They stop serving food at 10 p.m. but the bar stays open until midnight. Our waitress was supper nice!

We loved this restaurant. The restaurant has a beautiful view of Charleston. We thought the food was just average though and slightly overpriced.

review_list:
Good service and view. A must if you visit Charleston. We have been going for many years. You can watch the ships leave and come into port. It is a mainstay and has been updated. We can't wait to go back.

We found the perfect table, next to a kinetic sculpture made up of chrome rods positioned like a "Lite Brite" board. Press your human form into one side, and we can see the result from the other. I could have spent all night watching folks interact with the life-size sculpture, but eventually ran out of money. Basic mixed drinks (call...

Enjoyed a drink with friends. January weather kept us inside but we walked around the outside of the bar....great casual place.

Nice view of the city with lots of seating spaces both indoor and outdoor and a couple of different rooftops. Food and drink were decent and prices were fair.

Very comfy with couches to see the church peaks and sunset. Food is good. If you are able to grab one of the couches you will find yourself there for quite some time. We had tourists sit across from us and we chatted for an hour. Laid back and pretty.

View very nice. Servers great , friendly and customer oriented. Drinks and starters priced fairly. Very Convenient if staying at the Vendue.

Awesome rooftop! Great drinks and tasty nibbles. Service was slow though but the vibe there is awesome. Great for a date!

As a semi local before my husband and I relocated from SC it was important to me to take my sister to Charleston when she and I were traveling last month. Uninspired foods looked like somebody's leftovers. Watery drinks served in plastic cups like some local college bar. Table service was slow and inattentive. Cigar smokers nearby were obnoxious. Don't waste your money up there!

Wife & I walked 1/2 mile to have breakfast here. Not bad, not great. Open faced omelets made quickly and tasted good. Nothing to rave about. Never received the side of fruit we ordered.

review_list:
This is a must stop for any beer lover. I drove all the way from DE to pick up a few cases of rare beer that I can not get up here. The selection is out of this world. the prices are fair. If you are a craft beer person and you are anywhere near Charleston you must go.

I stopped in here on a recommendation from a buddy back home. There is an outstanding selection of local and overseas craft brews. Brandon was very helpful. If you're in the area and looking for the best beer selection in town. This is it.

I would have guessed, like another reviewer, this was some weird little grocery store or maybe like a medieval magic shop (?) and walked by several times. While visiting from out of state we asked a local waitress where we could fill a growler with a local brew, and she recommended this place. Fascinating. Fine art to brewing a quality beer and the folks here know it! Located on Exchange St by the Old Exchange across from the oldest continuing liquor establishment in the U.S.

Happy to have stumbled upon this place! We stopped in here before we headed down to hilton head, we knew this was our last chance to get something good for our trip. Great selection of craft beers and the staff was great. We all took shots of underberg, staff included. What else could you ask for! hit these guys up!

You cannot overstate the importance of the owners of this place to the awesome Charleston beer culture. Charleston was a beer wasteland before CBX and Coast brewing changed everything. This place is not only the best beer store in Chucktown, they are also a part of Charleston history.

Stayed at the Holiday Inn and we found the breakfasts at the Meeting Room wonderful.

The excellent service provided by Thomas, Dron, Jennifer made our stay in Charleston that much more delightful.
